Key Match Events: Luis Chávez scored the first goal for Mexico in the 43rd minute.
Álvarez scored the second goal for Mexico in the 90+10 minute.
Mexico won the match 2-0 on penalties (4-2)
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico needs to win 2-0 to qualify for the semifinals and if they concede, they must win by a four-goal difference regardless of the score.
The away goal does count as a tiebreaker in this qualifying round.

The Mexican National Team will face this second leg of the CONCACAF Nations League Quarterfinals with the greatest of responsibilities, but also with enormous pressure from its own and others, as it is playing for a ticket to the Copa América after having stumbled in Tegucigalpa in the first leg.
Post-Match Reflections: Mexico won the match 2-0 on penalties (4-2) to advance to the next round of the Nations League.
The pressure Jaime Lozano and his players will be under will be the greatest since the new era of the national D.
The Mexican tricolor will have to rethink the game at the Azteca Stadium as the pressure Jaime Lozano and his players will be under will be the greatest since the new era of the national D.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The player to watch for this match will be the captain and striker of the Catracho national team, Anthony Lozano.
The player to watch for this match will be Mexican center forward sensation of the moment, Santiago Giménez.
Estadio Azteca is an iconic soccer stadium located in Mexico City, Mexico.
The kick-off is scheduled at 9:30 pm ET.
Others: The last time Mexico faced Honduras in the capital of the tricolor country was in the final hexagonal of the qualifiers for Qatar 2022 where Mexico defeated Honduras 3-0.
América has not lost to Honduras since 2013 when they played each other in the final hexagonal on the road to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.
